intro: Cedronella madrensis, commonly known as the Madreños cedronella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers temperate climates with moderate rainfall. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
